I added this issue a while back: "[ 899909 ] Add charset detection to 
processing".  It lists a couple of java implementations of encoding 
recognizers including an implementation of mozilla's in java 
(http://www.i18nfaq.com/chardet.html <-- Is this your buddy Andy?).

Charset would be useful for sure but I think it comes after the heritrix 
exploitation of the charset information supplied -- the html meta I've 
going on about.

St.Ack





Andrew Boyko wrote:

> A colleague of mine here has ported the Mozilla character-set 
> detection library (originally C++) to Java.  Would that code be useful 
> in Heritrix?  As I understand it, it's a fairly comprehensive library 
> that, given a buffer whose character set is unknown, determines the 
> most likely answer based on statistical analysis.   The original C++ 
> code is found at 
> http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/extensions/universalchardet/src/
> and the ported Java version is, err, well, a link is forthcoming once 
> the fellow navigates the complexities of actually distributing it from 
> the LC's web space, but if it's potentially useful let me know.
